results.title: [Early cellular alterations induced by myocardial hypoxia: possible role of cyclic AMP (author's transl)].
results.text_hl: On the other hand, under conditions of beta-blockade (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@), @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@-induced tissular damage was reduced (Table II).

citations.NLM: de Leiris J, Bégué JM, Gauduel Y, Feuvray D. [Early cellular alterations induced by myocardial hypoxia: possible role of cyclic AMP (author's transl)]. J Physiol (Paris). 1980;76(7):813-9. PMID: 6260924
citations.BibTeX: @article{6260924, title={[Early cellular alterations induced by myocardial hypoxia: possible role of cyclic AMP (author's transl)].}, author={de Leiris J and Bégué JM and Gauduel Y and Feuvray D}, journal={J Physiol (Paris)}, volume={76}, number={7}, pages={813-9}}

results.title: Possible involvement of membrane-stabilizing action in beneficial effect of beta adrenoceptor blocking agents on hypoxic and posthypoxic myocardium.
results.text_hl: Treatment of @DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic hearts@@@ with either 100 microM @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, 200 microM @CHEMICAL_Acebutolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000070 @@@acebutolol@@@, 200 microM @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or 100 microM @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ was commenced when the contractile force declined to 30% of the initial level and terminated at 20-min @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@.

citations.NLM: Takeo S, Yamada H, Tanonaka K, Hayashi M, Sunagawa N. Possible involvement of membrane-stabilizing action in beneficial effect of beta adrenoceptor blocking agents on hypoxic and posthypoxic myocardium. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 1990 Sep;254(3):847-56. PMID: 1975623
citations.BibTeX: @article{1975623, title={Possible involvement of membrane-stabilizing action in beneficial effect of beta adrenoceptor blocking agents on hypoxic and posthypoxic myocardium.}, author={Takeo S and Yamada H and Tanonaka K and Hayashi M and Sunagawa N}, journal={J Pharmacol Exp Ther}, volume={254}, number={3}, pages={847-56}}

results.title: Hypoxia-stimulated glycerol production from the isolated, perfused rat heart is mediated by non-adrenergic mechanisms.
results.text_hl: The @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@-induced increase in @CHEMICAL_Glycerol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005990 @@@glycerol@@@ release during @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@ was inhibited by both @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@ (1 x 10(-5) M).

citations.NLM: Wardle CA, Riemersma RA. Hypoxia-stimulated glycerol production from the isolated, perfused rat heart is mediated by non-adrenergic mechanisms. Basic Res Cardiol. 1994 Jan-Feb;89(1):29-38. PMID: 8010933
citations.BibTeX: @article{8010933, title={Hypoxia-stimulated glycerol production from the isolated, perfused rat heart is mediated by non-adrenergic mechanisms.}, author={Wardle CA and Riemersma RA}, journal={Basic Res Cardiol}, volume={89}, number={1}, pages={29-38}}
